verse: So Jeremiah finished telling the people the message from the Lord their God; he told them everything the Lord their God had sent him to tell them.

Azariah son of Hoshaiah [42:1], Johanan son of Kareah, and some other men were ·too proud [arrogant]. They said to Jeremiah, “You are lying! The Lord our God did not send you to say, ‘You must not go to Egypt to ·live [sojourn; wander] there.’

Baruch son of Neriah [Jeremiah’s assistant; chs. 35; 45] is causing you to be against us. He wants you to hand us over to the ·Babylonians [Chaldeans] so they can kill us or ·capture us and take [exile] us to Babylon.”
So Johanan, the army officers, and all the people ·disobeyed the Lord’s command [did not listen to the voice of the Lord] to stay in Judah.

But Johanan son of Kareah and the army officers ·led away [took] ·those who were left alive from [the remnant of] Judah. They were the people who had ·run away from the Babylonians [been driven] to other countries but then had ·come back to live in [returned to] Judah.

They ·led away [took] the men, women, and children, and the king’s daughters. Nebuzaradan commander of the guard had ·put Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan in charge of those people [left with Gedaliah son of Ahikam son of Shaphan; who had been appointed governor]. Johanan also took Jeremiah the prophet and Baruch son of Neriah.
These people did not listen to the voice of the Lord. So they all went to Egypt to the city of Tahpanhes [in the eastern region of the Nile Delta].
In Tahpanhes the Lord spoke his word to Jeremiah:

“Take some large stones. Bury them in the clay in the brick pavement in front of the ·king of Egypt’s palace [house of Pharaoh] in Tahpanhes. Do this ·while the Jews are watching you [before the eyes of the Judeans].

Then say to them, ‘This is what the Lord ·All-Powerful [Almighty; of Heaven’s Armies; of hosts], the God of Israel, says: I will soon send for my servant, Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon. I will set his throne over these stones I have buried, and he will spread his ·covering for shade [canopy] above them.

He will come here and ·attack [strike] Egypt. He will bring death to those who are supposed to die. He will make ·prisoners [exiles] of those who are to be ·taken captive [exiled], and he will bring ·war to [to the sword] those who are to be killed with a sword.

Nebuchadnezzar will ·set [kindle a] fire to the ·temples [houses] of the gods of Egypt and burn them. And he will take ·the idols [them] away as captives. As a shepherd ·wraps himself in [or picks lice from] his clothes, so Nebuchadnezzar ·will wrap Egypt around him [or picks the land of Egypt clean]. Then he will safely leave Egypt.
He will ·destroy [break] the stone pillars in the ·temple [house] of the sun god in Egypt, and he will burn ·down [with fire] the ·temples [houses] of the gods of Egypt.’”
